purpose: Explain the ROGI metric and its implications for business health and reinvestment strategies.
title: ROGI as a Business Diagnostic Tool

bullets.text: ROGI serves as a proxy for current health of business and informs likely reinvestment economics.
Metric & rationale: Return on gross investment (ROGI) serves as a diagnostic proxy for business fundamental health and prospect for investment.
Calculation: EBITDA-taxes-CAPEX ÷ (Net working capital + Gross PPE + Other assets)
Example goals: Positive spread to WACC (8%-10%), Improvement in ROGI over time.

supporting_facts: ROGI is improved if it is below WACC.
Invest if ROGI is above WACC and will generate target or higher iTSR.
cta: Consider using other return metrics if they reflect underlying business characteristics.
